titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia Lewis O 83: Laylī va Majnūn.

availability.licence: These images and the content of Rare Book Department Lewis O 83: Laylī va Majnūn. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

msContents.summary: Illustrated copy of the story of Laylī and Majnūn in illustrated lacquered boards.

author.name: Free Library of Philadelphia. Rare Book Department. John Frederick Lewis Collection of Oriental Manuscripts

supportDesc.extent: i, 77, i leaves : 157 x 100 (125 x 80) mm, bound to 162 x 112 mm

layoutDesc.layout: 15 lines in two columns; catchwords every verso, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻlīq with elements of shikastah in black ink; pointed.

decoDesc.decoNote: Illuminated first page-opening with illuminated headpiece in blue, red, and gold with intricate gold floral marginal fill and gold between the rows and columns of text (f. 1v-2r). 13 polychrome and gold illustrations (f. 12v, 15r, 17r, 20v, 22v, 26r, 28r, 33v, 39v, 42r, 47r, 49v, 74v)

binding.p: Rebound in illustrated lacquered boards. The outside covers are the same and depict flowers and birds in reds and oranges framed in three frames, from inside to outside, a black with gold flowers followed by a red with green and gold flowers and another black with gold flowers. Front inside cover depicts a scene of five people eating and being served. Back inside cover also depicts five people drinking or serving; visible outside the window, four men and four boars.

origin.p: Item is undated, but likely produced in the first half of the 19th century.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by John Frederick Lewis.
